description: Third season of Oshiri Tantei.
Fourth season of Oshiri Tantei.

A short film by Okamoto Tadanari.
No synopsis information has been added to this title. Help improve our database by adding a synopsis here.

The protagonist is a mysterious assassin. In order to decide whether or not to carry out requests for assassination, he meets his targets to make a final judgment.

(Source: Official website)
2nd Season to Osiris no Tenbin.

name_japanese: おそ松くん あっぱれ！チビ太の鬼たいじザンス
description: New Year's Eve special of Osomatsu-kun (1988).

name_japanese: おそ松くん イヤミはひとり風の中
description: VHS released by Nippon Columbia.

The first short VR work of the popular TV anime Osomatsu-san. An immersive VR experience of the everyday lives of sextuplets. The setting is the bathhouse that fans know and love. The same all-star lineup of voice actors as the TV anime talk to you, a player in the VR world. It seems that only you have the supernatural powers to grant the wishes of each of the sextuplets. What is it that the sextuplets want? And can you indeed fulfill their wishes...?

(Source: Official Site)
A televised collaboration between Osomatsu-san and Mameshiba.

name_japanese: おそ松さん～はじまりはじまり～
description: A Daiichi (pachinko company) x Osomatsu-san fan event will be held on August 2nd. Character goods, attractions, mascots, and a mini-anime where the cast recreates classic Japanese tales. In particular: Tsuru no Ongaeshi, Urashima Tarou, Kaguya-hime, Saru Kani Gassen, Kintarou, and Momotarou.

A new anime short for Nagoya area tonkatsu shop Yabaton. The short on an outdoor screen near the main Yabaton shop and the main voice actor Fukushi Ochiai, who voices Buu-chan, will attend the premiere. 

The short follows the shy and kind-hearted Buu-chan and his unusual family as they get into both slapstick and heartwarming situations. 

Yabaton serves Nagoya's regionally famous street food, misokatsu, a pork cutlet in miso sauce, as well as other fried foods. The chain has many locations but its main shop is located is Yaba-cho in Nagoya city (specifically the Osu Shopping District) where it can be easily spotted thanks to its towering mascot. 

(Source: ANN)
Music video for the song Otanjoubi Omedetou by Megumi Shiina that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. The video was animated by Seiichi Hayashi.

name_japanese: おたのしみアニメ劇場
description: Based on the original story by Studio Zero.
An anime made for toddlers following weather themed characters, originally aired as a part of the early morning children's program Hirake! Ponkikki before the anime was combined and released on VHS.
Music video for the song Oto no Symphony by the NHK Tokyo Children's Choir (NHK Tokyo Jidou Gasshoudan) that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. The video was animated by Shuuichi Nakahara.
An animated adaptation of the folktale of Bunbuku Chagama.

name_japanese: おとぎマンガカレンダー
description:
A continuation of Instant History.

(Source: Cartoon Research)
Seven short films combined in one theatrical movie telling the story of Otogi's Studio voyage around the world.

name_japanese: 男どアホウ! 甲子園
description:
The story of a dim country boy who dreams of making it to the high school baseball championships in Koshien. Each 10 minutes episode ran from Monday to Saturday.

(Source: AniDB)

TV anime adaptation of Motomiya Hiroshi's manga "Otoko Ippiki Gaki Daishou" about young gang leader and all the trouble and fights his gang gets into, serialized in Weekly Shonen Jump.

(Source: AniDB)

name_japanese: 男はつらいよ 寅次郎忘れな草
description:
Anime adaptation of the "Otoko wa Tsurai yo (It's tough being a man)" film series by Youji Yamada.

Kuruma Torajirou (or Tora-san), a traveling salesman whose sole possessions include only the contents of a small suitcase, the clothes on his back and some pocket money, wanders from town to town peddling his wares.

(Source: Wikipedia)

After his father leaves when he is very young, Kyosuke Murata grows up under the thumb of his overprotective mother, Shizuko. When he reaches adulthood, he is thrown into the harsh, violent world of Japanese gangland when his mother becomes involved in a gang-related crime. He goes up against the Murata-gumi organization, only to find that his estranged father is its head. Rising up through the ranks, Kyosuke eventually unites half the gangs in Japan beneath his own leadership, only to find that the other half have also combined to resist his new power, starting the greatest gang war in Japanese history. 

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)
A karaoke music video featuring all-new animation released with the Japanese  Slayers Next DVD-BOX.
An adult comedy series following the life of Ikkyuu, a monk.

name_japanese: オトナの一休さん 第2シリーズ
description: The second season of Otona no Ikkyuu-san.

The series follows a young girl named Shina who hopes to become the world's best DJ, and is interested in new sounds. Shina explores a mysterious world filled with Otoppe, strange creatures capable of unique sounds.
A music video for the song "Otoshidama" by Hikari Ishida. Aired as part of NHK's Minna no Uta program.

Sachiko is unhappy and doesn't have a lot of energy. One day, a white rabbit appears and takes her to the "Land of the Moon." There, she meets her "true self," a happy and healthy girl, and Sachiko realizes she can be just like her.
Kids play in the park to late and return home thanks to the moon light helping guide the way.
A short puppet animation movie by Tadahito Mochinaga.
A psychedelic short film by Nobuhiro Aihara.
Stop-motion animation made out of fabric following a curious king sneaking out of his castle.
No synopsis information has been added to this title. Help improve our database by adding a synopsis here.
A bird steals a king's treasure and becomes upset. A boy helps the kind feel better and he realizes that his greatest treasure is his friends and family rather than gold and jewels.

name_japanese: 王様とナイチンゲール
description: A stop-motion adaptation of Hans Christian Anderson's The Nightingale.

Deep within my dream, there comes a landscape in my shapeless eyes. The peaceful sight gradually distorts. When anxiety and upsurge stands behind us, the nightly liberation begins.

(Source: YouTube)
Official music video for dOPPO's song Owakare which was included on the "Enrai" album.

He wears a bowl on his head and dances to the rhythms of Samba! What in the world is this creature? It is Owanco! He is a fairy dog who wears a bowl like a hat.
He loves food so much that he transforms himself into whatever food he pleases. His biggest fan and the admirer of tea-cupped-poodle, "Pooko-chan" and his rival cat, "Nori-Tama" (Nori=seaweed, Tama=the most typical name for cats in Japan) will join the fun ride.
By the way, what's for dinner tonight?

(Source: Official YouTube Channel)

name_japanese: 終わらない鎮魂歌を歌おう
description: A motivated man named Kota and shinigami #841 Yayoi's story. Kota is attracted to the work of the shinigami but can he actually become a one without suffering from his past?

name_japanese: 終わらない鎮魂歌を歌おう 青年のウタ
description: Kota has become a shinigami and his job is to follow a man at the end of his ropes. Slowly Kota learns about the man's life and what led him to this point.

name_japanese: 親子で学ぶ 火事の用心 地震の用心
description: An educational fire safety and earthquake safety short starring the cast of Oyako Club. The film was meant to be shown for parents and children together so that they may devise strategies as a family.
Kao Japan is a chemical and cosmetics company. They have commissioned Yoshiharu Satou to create an animated short about parents and adult children to promote their strong deodorizing products.
A song adaptation of the children's game King of the Hill.
A metaphorical song about the anxiety, frustration, lonliness, and heartache felt during puberty. Like that of wisdom teeth growing in, the pain follows you everywhere.
A stop-motion puppet animation adaptation of Hans Christian Anderson's Thumbelina.

name_japanese: オヨネコ ぶーにゃん
description:
Bad-tempered fat cat Oyoyo charms his idiot human family but fights an ongoing battle with other neighborhood pets.

(Source: The Anime Encyclopedia)

A song originally used in the children's television program Hirake Ponkikki. The popular CD was originally released in 1975. In 2008, it was released alongside an anime DVD with a music video.

The song starts by expressing how Taiyaki-kun and other taiyaki pancakes are fed up with being relentlessly cooked up on a hot plate day after day. In the song, Taiyaki-kun escapes to the sea, but ends up being caught and eaten by an angler.

(Source: Pop Matters)
